column4: for some reason when I boot Gnome it still says "Dapper Beta". Ive done sudo apt-get update/upgrade. is there anything else Im missing?
should I use OpenOffice.org or OpenOffice.org2?
sivik: how do i uninstall oo2. sudo apt-get remove openoffice.org2?
how do I install something with all it's dependencies automatically?
apt-get normally doest that..are you using dpkg?
I tried sudo apt-get install openoffice.org2 "The following packages have unmet dependencies:\n openoffice.org: Conflicts: openoffice.org2"
I think the problem was you cant have oo1 and oo2 installed at the same time
I think it just installs to a folder in the $HOME directory doesnt it?
it might be as simple as deleting the folder its in.
find / -name et returns a lot of different files scattered around the system
another idea...I wonder if you can run the .bin file with some type of uninstall option
does it have any readme files in its main folder?
wendigo, thanks guys - taking a look into ur advice atm
